attributes.description: This dashboard provides visibility into the Kafka controller's performance and health

params.markdown:
### Kafka Controller

This dashboard offers an end-to-end view of Kafka controller and cluster health.

- Monitors controller status, active and fenced brokers, and offline partitions to ensure cluster availability.  
- Provides cluster-level insights on total topics, partitions, and preferred replica imbalance for leadership balance.  
- Tracks controller latency, operations, errors, and broker heartbeat timeouts to detect performance bottlenecks.  
- Shows record processing lag, offsets, and controller elections to identify potential instability and processing delays.

embeddableConfig.description: Shows if the controller is active on the broker running jolokia endpoint
embeddableConfig.title: Controller status

embeddableConfig.description: The number of brokers that have been fenced
embeddableConfig.title: Active controller count

embeddableConfig.description: The total number of topic in the cluster
embeddableConfig.title: Topic count

embeddableConfig.description: The total number of partitions in the cluster
embeddableConfig.title: Cluster partition count

embeddableConfig.description: The number of partitions with preferred replica imbalance
embeddableConfig.title: Replica imbalance

embeddableConfig.description: The time taken to process events from the events queue.
embeddableConfig.title: Event processing latency

embeddableConfig.description: The time events wait in the queue before processing
embeddableConfig.title: Event queue wait time

embeddableConfig.description: The lag between the last applied record and the current time
embeddableConfig.title: Record lag

embeddableConfig.description: The offsets of applied and committed records
embeddableConfig.title: Record offsets

embeddableConfig.description: The number of controller elections over time
embeddableConfig.title: Controller elections
